description: Single-storey rear extension; installation of external fire escape stairs to the rear of the property; installation of a pergola (following the demolition of the existing pergola); construction of 4 single-storey detached garden huts (following the demolition of the existing garden huts); alterations to the existing rear roof light; the replacement of the side access gate; alterations to the front elevation including the installation of an illuminated swing sign; alterations to the side elevation including the installation of a written sign and trough light and alterations to the rear garden area including the installation of a timber deck, Astroturf and festoon lighting looped between timber posts.
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 3041.01.01; 3041.02.01; 3041.04.01; 3041.06.02; 3041.15.04; 3041.07.02; 3041.10.00 and 3041.22.03
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with the hereby approved plans and documents listed in condition 2 above.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7.8 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h)(j), 1.2 (f), 2.1 and 2.10, and policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
| No part of any of the flat roofs of the property or the hereby approved external staircase shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| The hereby approved garden huts at the rear of the property must be installed with Gyproc SoundBloc with acoustic insulation tight filled between the timber studs prior to first use and permanently retained thereafter in accordance with the hereby approved plan number 3041.15.04.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013).

| External artificial lighting at the development shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes for The Reduction of Light Pollution 2011'.  The use and level of lighting shall be minimised, and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by lighting, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013).

| Prior to use, gate posts shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted to neighbouring premises and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the gates.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise, in accordance with Policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013).

| No amplified noise or live music shall be played in external areas and at no time shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position during the playing of amplified noise or live music within the pub, in order to prevent the transmission of amplified or live music noise to external areas.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise /odour /smoke /fumes, in accordance with Policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013).

| Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, a tree-protection method statement for the proposed works, specifying the method of tree protection in accordance with BS 5837:2012 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing on site.
Reason: To ensure the preservation of protected trees.
